overview:
## Overview

`DateComponents` encapsulates the components of a date in an extendable, structured manner.

It is used to specify a date by providing the temporal components that make up a date and time in a particular calendar: hour, minutes, seconds, day, month, year, and so on. It can also be used to specify a duration of time, for example, 5 hours and 16 minutes. A `DateComponents` is not required to define all the component fields.

When a new instance of `DateComponents` is created, the date components are set to `nil`.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/DateComponents

# DateComponents

**Structure**

A date or time specified in terms of units (such as year, month, day, hour, and minute) to be evaluated in a calendar system and time zone.

## Declaration

```swift
struct DateComponents
```

## Overview

`DateComponents` encapsulates the components of a date in an extendable, structured manner.

It is used to specify a date by providing the temporal components that make up a date and time in a particular calendar: hour, minutes, seconds, day, month, year, and so on. It can also be used to specify a duration of time, for example, 5 hours and 16 minutes. A `DateComponents` is not required to define all the component fields.

When a new instance of `DateComponents` is created, the date components are set to `nil`.

## Initializing Date Components

- **init(calendar:timeZone:era:year:month:day:hour:minute:second:nanosecond:weekday:weekdayOrdinal:quarter:weekOfMonth:weekOfYear:yearForWeekOfYear:)**: Initializes a date components value, optionally specifying values for its fields.
- **calendar**: The calendar used to interpret the other values in this structure.
- **timeZone**: A time zone.

## Validating a Date

- **isValidDate**: Indicates whether the current combination of properties represents a date which exists in the current calendar.
- **isValidDate(in:)**: Indicates whether the current combination of properties represents a date which exists in the specified calendar.
- **date**: The date calculated from the current components using the stored calendar.

## Accessing Months and Years

- **era**: An era or count of eras.
- **year**: A year or count of years.
- **yearForWeekOfYear**: The year corresponding to a week-counting week.
- **quarter**: A quarter or count of quarters.
- **month**: A month or count of months.
- **isLeapMonth**: Set to true if these components represent a leap month.

## Accessing Weeks and Days

- **weekOfMonth**: A week of the month or a count of weeks of the month.
- **weekOfYear**: A week of the year or count of the weeks of the year.
- **weekday**: A weekday or count of weekdays.
- **weekdayOrdinal**: A weekday ordinal or count of weekday ordinals.
- **day**: A day or count of days.

## Accessing Hours and Seconds

- **hour**: An hour or count of hours.
- **minute**: A minute or count of minutes.
- **second**: A second or count of seconds.
- **nanosecond**: A nanosecond or count of nanoseconds.

## Accessing Calendar Components

- **value(for:)**: Returns the value of one of the properties, using an enumeration value instead of a property name.
- **setValue(_:for:)**: Set the value of one of the properties, using an enumeration value instead of a property name.
- **Calendar.Component**: An enumeration for the various components of a calendar date.

## Using Reference Types

- **NSDateComponents**: An object that specifies a date or time in terms of units (such as year, month, day, hour, and minute) to be evaluated in a calendar system and time zone.

## Structures

- **DateComponents.HTTPFormatStyle**: Converts `DateComponents` into RFC 9110-compatible “HTTP date” `String`, and parses in the reverse direction. This parser does not do validation on the individual values of the components. An optional date can be created from the result using `Calendar(identifier: .gregorian).date(from: ...)`. When formatting, missing or invalid fields are filled with default values: `Sun`, `01`, `Jan`, `2000`, `00:00:00`, `GMT`. Note that missing fields may result in an invalid date or time. Other values in the `DateComponents` are ignored.
- **DateComponents.ISO8601FormatStyle**: Options for generating and parsing string representations of dates following the ISO 8601 standard.

## Initializers

- **init(_:strategy:)**: Creates a new `DateComponents` by parsing the given string representation.
- **init(_:strategy:)**: Creates a new `DateComponents` by parsing the given representation.
- **init(subscriptionPeriod:)**

## Instance Properties

- **dayOfYear**
- **isRepeatedDay**: Set to true if these components represent a repeated day.

## Instance Methods

- **formatted(_:)**: Converts `self` to its textual representation.

## Type Aliases

- **DateComponents.Specification**
- **DateComponents.UnwrappedType**
- **DateComponents.ValueType**

## Type Properties

- **defaultResolverSpecification**

## Calendrical Calculations

- **Calendar**: A definition of the relationships between calendar units and absolute points in time, providing features for calculation and comparison of dates.
- **TimeZone**: Information about standard time conventions associated with a specific geopolitical region.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- ReferenceConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
